page.title: 02Historic Chideock Manor
page.content: Chideock Manor is situated in N. Chideock and was built in 1815 by Sir Humphrey Weld. Some of the materials used in it's construction, including a magnificent 15th century Chimney peice, must have come from the ruins if Chideock castle.(The outline of it's site can still be seen.) The Manor House with it's Roman Catholic church, has the main entrance on the Eastern side. This Eastern front overlooks lawns which sweep down towards the river Winniford which flows towards Chideock. The river has been enlarged within the grounds to make a lake. On the far side the land rises steeply and sheep graze. This scene well illustrates the pictoral setting of the Manor House. Over 1,000acres of land are now farmed by a company which has Cl.H.J.G.Weld M.C. D.L.as partner.
